channel.title: This problem blows my mind
channel.description: OK basically this guy logs in and gets 2 clicks before his whole client shuts down :confused: nd on my server log it's the client handler that's kicking him.

item.title: This problem blows my mind
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The client is a 32-bit program.
It requires 32-bit Java.

End of story.[/quote]

You tell 'em.

Read full topic

item.title: This problem blows my mind
item.dc:creator: @bigbaddrag bigbaddrag
item.description:
@bigbaddrag wrote:

[quote=“Vince, post:6, topic:351756”][quote author=bigbaddrag link=topic=448109.msg3288737#msg3288737 date=1280382827]
you don’t really have to download 32-bit java, just set the client runner to run of 64-bit java.

to do this, simply find the file that runs the client, edit it, and replace the word java with this

"C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe"

this is how I fixed clients on my computer (window 7). And I’m pretty sure I didn’t download 32-bit java
[/quote]

Mine didn’t come with Java, when I installed 64bit, I used jre, and it still crashed.[/quote]
well i’m not really sure, since this has always worked if i had a problem with a client like this

Read full topic

item.title: This problem blows my mind

item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“bigbaddrag, post:5, topic:351756”]you don’t really have to download 32-bit java, just set the client runner to run of 64-bit java.

to do this, simply find the file that runs the client, edit it, and replace the word java with this

"C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe"

this is how I fixed clients on my computer (window 7). And I’m pretty sure I didn’t download 32-bit java[/quote]

Mine didn’t come with Java, when I installed 64bit, I used jre, and it still crashed.

tell him download the 64 Bit Java

item.title: This problem blows my mind
item.dc:creator: @I_Loose_I I Loose I
item.description:
@I_Loose_I wrote:

One sec I’ll get a picture and his CMD shuts down completely. After the second click that is.

I just asked him about the OS And he is running W7

Read full topic

item.title: This problem blows my mind
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]If his client is shutting down, we need to see the error his client is outPrinting.

Though, I have a guess.
I believe he may be using Windows 7, or another 64-bit Operating System, trying to run a 32-bit program.

He needs to make sure he has 32-bit Java, with appropriate Environmental Variables.

As for the ‘kicking’ issue, I have no idea.[/quote]
^This and also does he get a error on the clients cmd?

Read full topic
